did.abstract: Barnett W. (Russ) Hamberger (1940- ) held various positions at New York University since 1965, including Director of Branch Campus Affairs, Assistant to the Vice President for Academic Planning, and Assistant Vice Chancellor for Student Affairs. In the 1970s, after serving in various positions within the department of Academic Program Review, he became Associate Provost. He also administered NYU's compliance with the Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act (FERPA) and managed staff who monitored academics and eligibility for NYU's athletics program. Hamberger served as NYU's voting delegate to the University Athletic Association from its inception in 1985. He retired from his position in 2016. He is the author of Violet Roots: New York University Athletics in the Nineteenth Century, published in 2024. The Barnett Hamberger Research Collection on New York University Athletics (dated 2017-2024) consist of research files created by Hamberger for his book Violet Roots: New York University Athletics in the Nineteenth Century. Materials include handwritten notes, annotated photocopies of journal articles, and annotated photocopies of archival documents, as well as correspondence and memoranda documenting the publication process.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Barnett W. (Russ) Hamberger (1940- ) held various positions at New York University since 1965, including Director of Branch Campus Affairs, Assistant to the Vice President for Academic Planning, and Assistant Vice Chancellor for Student Affairs. He received his bachelor's degree from Colgate University and M.A. from New York University. In the 1970s, after serving in various positions within the department of Academic Program Review, he became Associate Provost. While in this position, Hamberger reviewed new programs, served as liaison to the New York State Education Department on academic matters and to the University's regional accrediting agency. He also administered NYU's compliance with the Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act (FERPA) and managed staff who monitored academics and eligibility for NYU's athletics program. Hamberger also served as NYU's voting delegate to the University Athletic Association from its inception in 1985. He retired from his position in 2016. He is the author of Violet Roots: New York University Athletics in the Nineteenth Century, published in 2024.
